column1: Orgasmic dysfunction is when a woman either cannot reach orgasm, or has trouble reaching orgasm when she is sexually excited.
About 10 to 15% of women have never had an orgasm.

They include: - A history of sexual abuse or rape - Boredom in sexual activity - Certain prescription drugs, including common drugs used to treat depression, such as fluoxetine (Prozac), paroxetine (Paxil), and sertraline (Zoloft) - Hormonal disorders, hormone changes due to menopause, and chronic illnesses that affect health and sexual interest - Fatigue and stress - Negative attitudes toward sex (often learned in childhood or adolescence) - Shyness or embarrassment about asking for the type of stimulation that works best - Medical conditions that cause chronic pelvic pain, such as endometriosis - Medical conditions that affect the nerve supply to the pelvis, such as multiple sclerosis, diabetic neuropathy, and spinal cord injury
